data.title: Knight Can Capture...
data.statement:
You receive a chessboard and your goal is to find out: How much "material" can the White Knight capture?
The white knight is represented by a capital {{N}} somewhere on the chessboard. There will only ever be one knight. The knight can move 2 squares on one orthogonal axis and 1 square on the other. The knight can also jump over pieces, but he does not capture the pieces he jumps over.
Pieces are represented as follows:
{{p}} = 1 point
{{n}} = 3 points
{{b}} = 3 points
{{r}} = 5 points
{{q}} = 9 points

Note that lowercase characters represent your opponent's pieces, while uppercase represents your own.
You must find all the pieces the white knight can capture, add up their material value, and then output the result.
data.constraints: Input is always 8 lines that are 8 characters long.
data.stubGenerator:
loop 8
read row:string(8)
write correct answer
data.inputDescription:
<<8 lines:>> Each line is a string [[row]] which represents a row of the chessboard and the pieces (if any) on the row.
The input is as follows: A [[.]]  means an empty square, while an uppercase letter represents one of your pieces and a lowercase letter represents your opponent's pieces. The {{N}} represents the White Knight.
data.outputDescription: The amount of material the knight can capture from his square.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

You receive a chessboard and your goal is to find out: How much "material" can the White Knight capture?
The white knight is represented by a capital N somewhere on the chessboard. There will only ever be one knight. The knight can move 2 squares on one orthogonal axis and 1 square on the other. The knight can also jump over pieces, but he does not capture the pieces he jumps over.
Pieces are represented as follows:
p = 1 point
n = 3 points
b = 3 points
r = 5 points
q = 9 points

Note that lowercase characters represent your opponent's pieces, while uppercase represents your own.
You must find all the pieces the white knight can capture, add up their material value, and then output the result.
Input
8 lines: Each line is a string row which represents a row of the chessboard and the pieces (if any) on the row.
The input is as follows: A . means an empty square, while an uppercase letter represents one of your pieces and a lowercase letter represents your opponent's pieces. The N represents the White Knight.
Output
The amount of material the knight can capture from his square.
Constraints
Input is always 8 lines that are 8 characters long.
Example
Input
........
........
.....p..
...N....
........
........
........
........
Output
1
